analyzed: nye bar brtson pa ni mngon par brtson pa dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' 'di bcom ldan 'das ma 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Application is the engagement of the Bodhisattva in the retention of the Bhagavatƒ´ through being endowed with striving.

original: de yang byang chub bsgrub pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang byang chub bsgrub pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: byang chub de bzhin du rigs pa dag gis yang dag par ston pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub de bzhin du rigs pa dag gis yang dag par ston pa ste /

original: de nas yang dag par 'god pa ni klog pa dang mchod pa la sogs pa la gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang dag par 'god pa ni klog pa dang mchod pa la sogs pa la gzhug pa'o //
translated: Then, the correct establishment is the engagement in reading, worship, and so forth.

original: zhugs pa dag la ni yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhugs pa dag la ni yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / spro bar bya ste /

original: brtson 'grus dang / le lo gnyis kyi yon tan dang skyon bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / le lo gnyis kyi yon tan dang skyon bsgrags pa'o //

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni bstod pa dag gis yang dag par dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni bstod pa dag gis yang dag par dga' bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'di dag la 'jig rten dag ni phyin ci log pa yin te 'di ston par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /

original: tshig la mtshon pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshig la mtshon pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: 'jig rten ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rnam pa gsum ste /

original: 'bad na zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gis so //

analyzed: de ni chung ngu'i chen po'i bstod pa'o //

analyzed: 'dir mdo las 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
translated: Here, in the sutra, it is said: ‚ÄúSeparated from sense objects,üîΩseparated from evil and unwholesome things.

original: @79a * // sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //üîΩde rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi zhing nang yongs su dang ste sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: @79a * // sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi zhing nang yongs su dang ste sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa /
translated: He achieves and remains in the first concentration, which is with-in- volvement and scrutiny, and is born of detachment and is full of joy and bliss.

analyzed: dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las gyur pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan
translated: With the stilling of involvement and scrutiny, he achieves and remains in the second concentration, which is born of concentration, is full of joy and bliss, and is without involvement and scrutiny.

original: gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: With the fading away of joy, he achieves and remains in the third concentration, abiding in equanimity, mindful and discerning, experiencing in his person that bliss of which the noble ones say: ‚ÄúHappily lives he who is equanimous and mindful,üîΩhe achieves and remains in the fourth concentration, which is neither blissful nor suffering, and is completely purified in equanimity and mindfulness.

original: de bde ba yang spangs yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas /
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas /
translated: He also abandons pleasure, and the disappearance of both pleasure and pain,

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag ba bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag ba bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and he attains and dwells in the fourth meditation, which is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa dag la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa dag la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is said to be ‚Äúdetached from sense desires‚Äù because he is not associated with the sense desires of passion, and because he does not focus on the sense desires of things.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa'o //
translated: He is said to be ‚Äúdetached from evil and nonvirtuous things‚Äù because he is detached from the evil and nonvirtuous things that are the cause of the sense desires of passion, and because he is detached from the evil and nonvirtuous things that are the cause of the sense desires of things.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i gnyen po rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i gnyen po rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is said to be ‚Äúendowed with investigation and analysis‚Äù because he is endowed with the investigation and analysis that are the antidote to the sense desires.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa las dben pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa las dben pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Born of seclusion means born of seclusion from the desire realm.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba ni 'dod pa'i don grub pa ste gnas so zhes bya ba lus dang ngag dang yid gsum shin tu sbyangs pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba ni 'dod pa'i don grub pa ste gnas so zhes bya ba lus dang ngag dang yid gsum shin tu sbyangs pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan ba'o //
translated: Joy and bliss means accomplishing the desired aim and abiding in it, endowed with the joy and bliss of the complete training of body, speech, and mind.

original: bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni bsgrubs nas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni bsgrubs nas gnas pa ste /
translated: Having achieved the first concentration means having achieved and abided in it.

original: nye bar bsgrubs pa ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs pa ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: Achievement means perfect achievement.

original: gnas so zhes bya ba ni rjes su myong ba'o //
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba ni rjes su myong ba'o //
translated: Abiding means experiencing.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de nyid rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pas sems 'khrul pa nyid kyi skyon mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de nyid rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pas sems 'khrul pa nyid kyi skyon mthong ba ste /
translated: That refers to the yogin seeing the fault of the mind being confused due to conceptualization and analysis.

original: de las bzlog nas ting nge 'dzin la gnas @79b pa'o ;
analyzed: de las bzlog nas ting nge 'dzin la gnas @79b pa'o ;
translated: Having turned away from that, he abides in concentration.

original: / rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi zhing zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis sems gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: / rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi zhing zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis sems gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: With the pacification of conceptualization and analysis means due to the power of concentration, the mind becomes one-pointed.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of the uninterrupted engagement of discursive thought and investigation.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dzin pa med pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dzin pa med pas so //
translated: The absence of discursive thought and the absence of investigation are due to the absence of all grasping.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni rigs pa nyid kyi phyir de btang snyoms yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni rigs pa nyid kyi phyir de btang snyoms yin te /
translated: The absence of delight and passion is due to equanimity, because it is proper.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa la dga' ba la yang btang snyoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa la dga' ba la yang btang snyoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also due to equanimity with regard to the delight in discursive thought and investigation.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin can zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i go skabs mi sbyin zhing shes rab lan mang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin can zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i go skabs mi sbyin zhing shes rab lan mang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The possession of mindfulness and introspection is due to the absence of the opportunity for delight and the frequent practice of wisdom.

original: bde ba ni myong ba'i bde ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni myong ba'i bde ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Bliss is the bliss of feeling and the bliss of pliancy.

original: lus kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi lus dang / yid kyi lus so //
analyzed: lus kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi lus dang / yid kyi lus so //
translated: The body is the body of form and the body of mind.

original: 'phags pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: The noble ones are the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

translated: It is called the sphere of infinite space because it is the sphere in which one perceives only infinite space, thinking ‚Äúspace is infinite.‚Äù

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'da' bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'da' bar bya zhe na /
translated: How does one transcend the sphere of infinite space?

original: de shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la mos pa dang ldan pa mtha' yas pa de nyid la mos par byas nas /üîΩthams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la mos pa dang ldan pa mtha' yas pa de nyid la mos par byas nas / thams cad du nam mkha'i 'du shes las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the cognition that transcends the sphere of infinite space, one perceives the infinite space of the sphere of infinite space.üîΩOne transcends the notion of infinite space by perceiving the infinite consciousness of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One transcends the sphere of infinite consciousness by perceiving the nothingness of the sphere of nothingness.

original: de de las bskyod nas cung zad kyang dmigs par mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de de las bskyod nas cung zad kyang dmigs par mi mthong ste /
translated: Having transcended that, he does not see even the slightest object.

original: don med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med de cung zad tsam nyid du dmigs par byas nas thob pa'o //
analyzed: don med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med de cung zad tsam nyid du dmigs par byas nas thob pa'o //
translated: He attains the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception by perceiving the absence of any object and the absence of any perception, even the slightest.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes las kyang 'dod chags dang bral nas de yang bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes las kyang 'dod chags dang bral nas de yang bzlog pa yin te /
translated: Having become detached from the perception of the sphere of nothingness, he also transcends that.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched ni sngar log @81b pa de nas 'du shes med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched ni sngar log @81b pa de nas 'du shes med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The sphere of nothingness was previously transcended, but not the perception of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: 'du shes ni rab tu phra bar 'jug pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'du shes ni rab tu phra bar 'jug pa kho na ste /
translated: Perception operates in a subtle way.

original: des na 'du shes med pa ni 'du shes med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'du shes med pa ni 'du shes med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is not non-perception.

original: gang du 'du shes med pa yang ma yin pa'i skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang du 'du shes med pa yang ma yin pa'i skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The concentration of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is so called because it is not a sphere of non-perception.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga la rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / lha'i mig go //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga la rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / lha'i mig go //
translated: The five superknowledges are: the knowledge of the performance of miracles, the knowledge of the divine ear, the knowledge of the minds of others, the knowledge of the recollection of previous lives, and the knowledge of the divine eye.

original: 'dir mdo las de rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa du ma nyid du myong bar byed de sa yang g-yo bar byed /
analyzed: 'dir mdo las de rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa du ma nyid du myong bar byed de sa yang g-yo bar byed /
translated: Here, the Sutra says: ‚ÄúHe experiences the many kinds of miracles, and he shakes the earth.

original: gcig tu gyur cing mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por yang gyur nas gcig tu gyur ba dang / steng du 'byung ba dang nub pa yang nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur cing mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por yang gyur nas gcig tu gyur ba dang / steng du 'byung ba dang nub pa yang nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: He becomes one and then many, and having been many he becomes one again. He appears and disappears.

original: thad kar rtsig pa dang / thad kar ra ba dang / thad kar ri la yang thogs pa med par 'gro'o //
analyzed: thad kar rtsig pa dang / thad kar ra ba dang / thad kar ri la yang thogs pa med par 'gro'o //
translated: He goes through walls, through enclosures, through mountains, without being obstructed.

original: nam mkha' la yang 'gro'o //üîΩsa la yang 'byung ba dang byi zul byed do //üîΩchu la yang sa bzhin du 'gro'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang 'gro'o // sa la yang 'byung ba dang byi zul byed do // chu la yang sa bzhin du 'gro'o //
translated: He goes through the sky.üîΩHe dives into the earth as if it were water.

original: du ba 'thul bar byed /
analyzed: du ba 'thul bar byed /
translated: He walks on water without sinking as if it were dry land.

original: 'bar bar yang byed do zhes rgyas par yang brjod do //
analyzed: 'bar bar yang byed do zhes rgyas par yang brjod do //
translated: He emits smoke and flames like a great bonfire.üîΩAnd he touches and strokes with his hand the sun and moon, those great and powerful ones, and he controls his body as far as the Brahma world.‚Äù

original: de lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis mi las 'das pa'i sgra yang thos te lha dang mi dag go //
analyzed: de lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis mi las 'das pa'i sgra yang thos te lha dang mi dag go //
translated: With the divine ear, they hear sounds that are both divine and human, and those that are beyond humans.üîΩThey know the minds of other beings and other individuals as they truly are.

original: de sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi sems sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /üîΩde 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi sems sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te / de 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: They know a mind that is attached as a mind that is attached.üîΩThey know a mind that is detached as a mind that is detached. They know a mind that is angry as a mind that is angry, and a mind that is not angry as a mind that is not angry. They know a mind that is in a state of delusion as a mind that is in a state of delusion, and a mind that is not in a state of delusion as a mind that is not in a state of delusion.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa nas /
translated: They know a mind that is inferior as a mind that is inferior, and a mind that is superior as a mind that is superior. They know a mind that is middling as a mind that is middling. They know a mind that is concentrated as a mind that is concentrated, and a mind that is not concentrated as a mind that is not concentrated. They know a mind that is liberated as a mind that is liberated, and a mind that is not liberated as a mind that is not liberated.

original: bla na med pa'i sems la bla na med pa'i ye shes so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sems la bla na med pa'i ye shes so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: They know a mind that is ordinary as a mind that is ordinary, and a mind that is extraordinary as a mind that is extraordinary. They know a mind that is not extraordinary as a mind that is not extraordinary. They know a mind that is surpassable as a mind that is surpassable, and a mind that is unsurpassable as a mind that is unsurpassable.

original: de skye ba gcig rjes su dran pa nas gnyis dang gsum nas bye ba brag bcu dang / brgya phrag stong gi bar du yang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: de skye ba gcig rjes su dran pa nas gnyis dang gsum nas bye ba brag bcu dang / brgya phrag stong gi bar du yang rjes su dran no //
translated: He remembers one birth, two, three, up to a hundred thousand births, up to many hundreds of thousands of births.üîΩHe remembers one day and night, two, three, up to a hundred thousand days and nights, up to many hundreds of thousands of days and nights.

original: nyi ma gcig nas gnyis dang / gsum nas bskal pa bye ba phrag bcu dang / brgya phrag stong gi bar du yang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: nyi ma gcig nas gnyis dang / gsum nas bskal pa bye ba phrag bcu dang / brgya phrag stong gi bar du yang rjes su dran no //
translated: He remembers one eon, two, three, up to a hundred thousand eons, up to many hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: bdag ni che ge mo zhig na gnas /
analyzed: bdag ni che ge mo zhig na gnas /
translated: He remembers: ‚ÄúI was born in such and such a place,

original: ming ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: ming ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: had such and such a name,

original: de bzhin du rus dang / de bzhin du rigs dang / de bzhin du zas dang / de bzhin du gnas pa'i yun ring thung dang / de bzhin du tshe'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rus dang / de bzhin du rigs dang / de bzhin du zas dang / de bzhin du gnas pa'i yun ring thung dang / de bzhin du tshe'i mtha'o //
translated: such and such a caste, such and such a family, ate such and such food, had such and such experiences of pleasure and pain, lived for such and such a length of time, and after dying here was born there.

original: de nas bdag shi 'phos nas che @82a * //üîΩge mor skyes so zhes bya ba nas de nas 'dir skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar dang / rnam pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de nas bdag shi 'phos nas che @82a * // ge mor skyes so zhes bya ba nas de nas 'dir skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar dang / rnam pa dang bcas /
translated: ‚Äù In this way, he remembers many details,

original: yul phyogs dang bcas /üîΩdan rtags dang bcas pa rnam pa du ma shes pa'i bar du ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: yul phyogs dang bcas /üîΩdan rtags dang bcas pa rnam pa du ma shes pa'i bar du ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: such as the country,üîΩthe town, the village, the family, the food, the pleasure and pain, the length of life, and after dying here he was born there.

original: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang / skye ba dang / skyes pa dang / kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa dang / bde 'gro dang /
analyzed: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang / skye ba dang / skyes pa dang / kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa dang / bde 'gro dang /
translated: With that pure divine eye, which surpasses the human, they see the deaths of beings, their births, whether they are good or bad, whether they are inferior or excellent, whether they are going to happy or to evil destinies,

original: ngan 'gro dang / sems can las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba mthong zhing rab tu shes pa yin te /
analyzed: ngan 'gro dang / sems can las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba mthong zhing rab tu shes pa yin te /
translated: With their pure divine eye, which surpasses the human, they see and know the deaths of sentient beings, their births, whether they are good or bad, high or low, beautiful or ugly, and whether they are going to a happy or an unfortunate realm.

original: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang / ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa 'phags pa rnams la skur ba mi 'debs pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa dag ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang / ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa 'phags pa rnams la skur ba mi 'debs pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa dag ste /
translated: They see and know that sentient beings who have good physical, verbal, and mental conduct, who do not slander the noble ones, and who have the right view,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyod pa'i rgyus lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyod pa'i rgyus lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will, due to the cause of good physical, verbal, and mental conduct, be born in a good realm, in a heavenly world, when their body breaks up.

original: yang sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yang sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThese beings have engaged in negative physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur ba 'debs pa log par lta ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur ba 'debs pa log par lta ba dag ste /
translated: They have slandered the noble ones and have wrong views.

original: de dag la log par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig pa'i 'og tu shi nas kyang gang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la log par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig pa'i 'og tu shi nas kyang gang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the causes they have accumulated through their wrong views, when their bodies disintegrate, they will die and fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hells.

original: de ltar lha'i mig mi las 'das pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
analyzed: de ltar lha'i mig mi las 'das pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
translated: In this way, with his divine eye, which surpasses the human, he sees all the worlds in the ten directions, as far as the limits of space and the realm of totality.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa'i 'gro ba rigs drug gi sems can rnams kyi skye ba dang ; 'chi ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa'i 'gro ba rigs drug gi sems can rnams kyi skye ba dang ; 'chi ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin te /
translated: He sees the beings of the six realms of existence and knows their deaths and rebirths exactly as they are.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa so so dang / tha dad pa 'di dag la rab tu bkod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa so so dang / tha dad pa 'di dag la rab tu bkod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas establish them in the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the superknowledges, and the individual and distinct states.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste 'di ni bkur ba dang po'o ;
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste 'di ni bkur ba dang po'o ;
translated: The rest is easy to understand. This is the first kind of respect.

original: / de'i 'og tu koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rnam grangs 'di lta bur bkod pa lta zhog ces bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi ba la bkod na zhes bya ba'i bar dang / so so'i mthar yang de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas yang dag pa'i mtha' rab tu 'byed pa la @82b 'dul bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang bcas pa'i go rims bzhin du gnyis pa dang /
analyzed: / de'i 'og tu koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rnam grangs 'di lta bur bkod pa lta zhog ces bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi ba la bkod na zhes bya ba'i bar dang / so so'i mthar yang de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas yang dag pa'i mtha' rab tu 'byed pa la @82b 'dul bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang bcas pa'i go rims bzhin du gnyis pa dang /
translated: Then, after that, ‚ÄúKo≈õika, let alone all the beings of Jambudvƒ´pa, up to having established them in the fourth meditation,‚Äù and at the end of each, ‚ÄúWhat do you think, Kau≈õika? Up to ‚Ä¶ would distinguish the limit of reality.‚Äù

original: gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga ba dang / drug pa'i bkur ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga ba dang / drug pa'i bkur ba'o //
translated: The second, third, fourth, fifth, and sixth kinds of respect are in the same order as the above.

original: de ni chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po'i bkur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po'i bkur ba'o //
translated: That is the homage of the small-small, the small-great, the medium-small, the medium-medium, and the medium-great.

original: gzhan yang koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Moreover, Kau≈õika, from a son or daughter of good family up to

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bdun pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bdun pa bstan to //
translated: Kau≈õika, it is thus teaches the seventh.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma gzhan dag la byin pa ni snga ma dag la yang yod de 'dir ni rang nyid klog pa dang / gzhan dag la byin nas kyang lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma gzhan dag la byin pa ni snga ma dag la yang yod de 'dir ni rang nyid klog pa dang / gzhan dag la byin nas kyang lhag pa yin te /
translated: Giving the Blessed Lady to others is also found in the previous [stages], but here it is superior because of reading it oneself and giving it to others.

original: de ni chen po'i chung ngu'i bkur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni chen po'i chung ngu'i bkur ba'o //
translated: That is the homage of the great-small.

original: gzhan yang koo shi ka rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo don la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzhan yang koo shi ka zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brgyad pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yang koo shi ka rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo don la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzhan yang koo shi ka zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brgyad pa bstan to //
translated: Moreover, Kau≈õika, from a son or daughter of good family who is skilled in meaning up to Kau≈õika, it is thus teaches the eighth.

original: 'di'i don rnam par 'grel pa dang zhes gang sngar gsungs pa dang / don la mkhas pa zhes bya ba de gnyis las snga ma ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa las sems nyams pa rags pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dag la dang ba bskyed par bsams pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don rnam par 'grel pa dang zhes gang sngar gsungs pa dang / don la mkhas pa zhes bya ba de gnyis las snga ma ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa las sems nyams pa rags pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dag la dang ba bskyed par bsams pa yin la /
translated: The phrase explaining its meaning refers to the above phrase skilled in its meaning, and the two terms refer to the following. The first term refers to the generation of faith in those who grasp the coarse nature of the degeneration of mind with regard to the perfection of wisdom and so on.

original: 'dir ni mtha' gsum du mi dmigs pa la sogs pa don dam par bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni mtha' gsum du mi dmigs pa la sogs pa don dam par bsams pa yin te /
translated: Here, however, it refers to the ultimate, such as the nonapprehension of the three spheres and so on.

original: de la don la mkhas pa'i tshig ni don yid la byed pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de la don la mkhas pa'i tshig ni don yid la byed pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: Among them, the phrase skilled in its meaning refers to the phrase attending to its meaning.

original: don dang bcas pa pa ni de nyid kyi don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: don dang bcas pa pa ni de nyid kyi don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing meaning refers to possessing that very meaning.

original: tshig 'bru dang bcas pa ni de nyid kyi don gyi tshig 'bru dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru dang bcas pa ni de nyid kyi don gyi tshig 'bru dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing words refers to possessing the words of that very meaning.

original: bstan pa ni de'i don mdor yang dag par ston pas so //
analyzed: bstan pa ni de'i don mdor yang dag par ston pas so //
translated: Teaching refers to teaching its meaning in brief.

original: yongs su gsal bar byed pa ni rigs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar byed pa ni rigs pa dag gis so //
translated: Fully revealing refers to revealing it with reasonings.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'i spyod pa lhag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'i spyod pa lhag pa ste /
translated: This refers to the superior practice of the eighth stage.

original: 'di ni brgyad pa'i skabs yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ni brgyad pa'i skabs yin pas so //
translated: This is the eighth stage.

original: de bas zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i spyod pa las so //üîΩ'di yang bstan par bgyi ba lags so zhes bya ba ni zur gyes sam /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i spyod pa las so // 'di yang bstan par bgyi ba lags so zhes bya ba ni zur gyes sam /
translated: Therefore, means from the practice of the seventh stage.

original: lus kyi brdas dris pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi brdas dris pa ste /
translated: This also should be taught, means that it is asked by a gesture of the body or a hint.

original: bstan par bya ba ni ma yin te gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams so //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ni ma yin te gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams so //
translated: It is not to be taught, because it is well known.

original: khong du ma chud pa dag la zhes bya ba ni shes pa blun pa ste /
analyzed: khong du ma chud pa dag la zhes bya ba ni shes pa blun pa ste /
translated: To those who have not understood, means to those who are ignorant.

original: de ni rigs pa dang lung dag gis yang dag par ma zin pa gzhan gyi tshig gi g-yo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa dang lung dag gis yang dag par ma zin pa gzhan gyi tshig gi g-yo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because they are not properly grasped by reasoning and scripture, and they are moved by the words of others.

original: 'di gang gis g-yo bar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'di gang gis g-yo bar byed ce na /
translated: By what are they moved?

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba smras so //

original: de ltar na gnas skabs gzhan du 'pho ba 'am snga ma 'jig cing phyi ma skye ba ni yongs su bsngo ba yin na chos kyi dbyings ni gnas skabs de lta bu yang ma yin te 'pho ba med cing 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Thus, dedication is the movement to another state or the destruction of the former and the arising of the latter. But the dharma-dhƒÅtu is not like that, because it is without movement and without destruction.

original: spyos pa ni kha zer ba'o //
analyzed: spyos pa ni kha zer ba'o //

original: brdegs pa ni bsnun pa'o //
analyzed: brdegs pa ni bsnun pa'o //

original: brgyad pa ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon brjod pa'o //

original: bcas pa ni ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcas pa ni ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rmugs pa nyid kyi zil gyis gnon par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa nyid kyi zil gyis gnon par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: de la rmugs pa ni sems las su mi rung zhing zhum pa ste sems las su mi rung zhing gang zhum pa'i mtshan nyid can ni rang gi dmigs pa mi rtogs pa ste rmugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rmugs pa ni sems las su mi rung zhing zhum pa ste sems las su mi rung zhing gang zhum pa'i mtshan nyid can ni rang gi dmigs pa mi rtogs pa ste rmugs pa'o //

original: gnyid ni 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa ste /
analyzed: gnyid ni 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa ste /

analyzed: sems sdud pa yang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas 'jug pa med pa'o //

original: sems 'jug pa rang dbang med pa de ni gnyid nyid do //
analyzed: sems 'jug pa rang dbang med pa de ni gnyid nyid do //

original: lhag ma le'u rdzogs pa'i bar ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma le'u rdzogs pa'i bar ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand up to the end of the chapter.

original: thabs ni rnam par grol ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: thabs ni rnam par grol ba dang 'dra'o //

original: des na chos kyi dbyings la mi dmigs pa'i rjes su yi rang ba 'di ni @93a * //
analyzed: des na chos kyi dbyings la mi dmigs pa'i rjes su yi rang ba 'di ni @93a * //
translated: Therefore, this rejoicing in the non-apprehension of the dharma-dhƒÅtu

original: thabs kyi rjes su yi rang ba ste gnyis pa'o //üîΩrjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba ni de dag go //
analyzed: thabs kyi rjes su yi rang ba ste gnyis pa'o // rjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba ni de dag go //
translated: is the second rejoicing, the rejoicing in the means.üîΩRejoicing and dedication are those.

original: de rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni rjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i le'u'o //
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni rjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i le'u'o //

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u drug pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u drug pa'o /
translated: This concludes ‚ÄúThe Essence of the Most Sublime Dharma, the Root of All the Tantras,‚Äù the sixth chapter of ‚ÄúThe Supreme Essence,‚Äù the commentary on the eight-thousand-verse Perfection of Wisdom.

original: // /'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i lam yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum bshad nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bsgrub pa dang / shin tu dag pa zhes bya ba sngar yang bstan nas /
analyzed: // /'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i lam yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum bshad nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bsgrub pa dang / shin tu dag pa zhes bya ba sngar yang bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the three types of attention in the mundane path of cultivation, the treatise now presents the supramundane path of cultivation.

original: de la bsgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la bsgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: In terms of the essence of the practice, the treatise states:

original: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
translated: Its essence is supreme,üîΩnot manifest to all,

original: kun la mngon du mi byed dang // chos dbyings dmigs pa med par ni //
analyzed: kun la mngon du mi byed dang // chos dbyings dmigs pa med par ni //

original: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //üîΩces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid // ces bya ba gsungs te /

original: sgrub pa de'i yan lag ni lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa de'i yan lag ni lnga ste /

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su bsgrub pa la sogs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su bsgrub pa la sogs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom of the path of cultivation is the essence of the perfection of wisdom of the path of cultivation, such as the accomplishment of the gnosis of omniscience, turning the wheel of the Dharma, and so on.

original: mchog nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mchog nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug mngon par bsgrub pa'o //

original: chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa ni kun la mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa ni kun la mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
translated: The non-conditioning of all phenomena is the non-conditioning of all.

original: chos thams cad la mi dmigs par gtod par byed pa ni gtod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi dmigs par gtod par byed pa ni gtod par byed pa'o //
translated: The directing of all phenomena to non-apprehension is the directing.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid kyi byang chub 'thob pa ni don chen po nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid kyi byang chub 'thob pa ni don chen po nyid do //
translated: The attainment of enlightenment through the non-apprehension of all phenomena is the great meaning.

original: de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, from there, the Blessed One... and so on is stated.

original: 'di la bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang gi ngo bo'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang gi ngo bo'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the perfection of wisdom of the essence of the path of cultivation itself?

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One, etc.

original: gang las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is so called because he is the one from whom the knowledge of the Omniscient One is perfected.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The knowledge of the Omniscient One is the knowledge that has abandoned the latent predispositions of all obscurations.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has the meaning of being endowed with the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of knowledge.

original: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de de nyid kyi rig pa ni 'dir gsal bar byed pa lags so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de de nyid kyi rig pa ni 'dir gsal bar byed pa lags so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, that knowledge of the Omniscient One is the illumination here.

original: sgrib ba mun pa thams cad spangs pa ni gsal ba ste @93b de byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib ba mun pa thams cad spangs pa ni gsal ba ste @93b de byed pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of all the darkness of obscurations is illumination, and he is the one who creates that.

original: 'di spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of abandonment.

original: chos thams cad don par snang ba ni gsal la ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad don par snang ba ni gsal la ba ste /
translated: The appearance of all phenomena as objects is illumination,

original: de byed pa ni ye shes phun dum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de byed pa ni ye shes phun dum tshogs pa'o //
translated: and he is the one who creates that. This is the perfection of knowledge.

original: des na de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: des na de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Therefore, I pay homage to him.

original: zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus so //
translated: This is the present time.

original: phyag bgyi bar 'os pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du ma 'ongs pa'i dus su'o//
analyzed: phyag bgyi bar 'os pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du ma 'ongs pa'i dus su'o//
translated: Worthy of worship is the future time.

original: tshig gcig po des ni phun sum tshogs pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig po des ni phun sum tshogs pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: By this one word, the two perfections are indicated.

original: da ni tshig gnyis kyis spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni tshig gnyis kyis spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, by two words, the perfection of abandonment is stated:

original: ma gos pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa'i dri ma thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma gos pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa'i dri ma thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unstained means that all stains of obscuration are exhausted.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi gos pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i dri ma thams cad zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi gos pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i dri ma thams cad zad pa'o //
translated: Free from the stain of the whole world means that all stains of the three realms are exhausted.

original: de ni tshig gnyis kyis ye shes phun sum tshogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni tshig gnyis kyis ye shes phun sum tshogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, by two words, the perfection of intuition is stated:

original: chos thams cad don dam par snang ba'i snang ba ste byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par snang ba'i snang ba ste byed pa'o //
translated: The light of all things is the illumination of all things ultimately.

original: tshig 'og ma gnyis ni gtan tshigs gsungs te rab rib ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'og ma gnyis ni gtan tshigs gsungs te rab rib ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: The next two words state the reason: cataracts are ignorance.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rab rib dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rab rib dang bral ba ste /
translated: The opposite of that is freedom from cataracts.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of intuition.

original: thams cad ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: All means without exception.

original: khams gsum gyi don dam pa de la rab rib dang bral bar byed pa de ni dmigs pas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi don dam pa de la rab rib dang bral bar byed pa de ni dmigs pas khyab pa'o //
translated: The ultimate of the three realms is made free from cataracts by that, and that is pervaded by the objective support.

original: nyon mongs pa dang lta ba de dag nyid mun pa ste thams cad kyang yin de dag kyang yin pas de dag thams cad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang lta ba de dag nyid mun pa ste thams cad kyang yin de dag kyang yin pas de dag thams cad do //
translated: Those very afflictions and views are darkness, and they are all, and they are all of them.

original: de dag sel ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad zad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sel ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad zad pa'o //
translated: The removal of those is the exhaustion of all adverse elements.

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: All of this teaches the perfection of one's own aim.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With reference to the perfection of others' aims, it is said:

original: bstan par bgyi ba lags so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang thob par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: bstan par bgyi ba lags so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang thob par 'dod pas so //
translated: The Blessed One should teach it means by one who desires to attain the state of omniscience.

original: mchog gi tshig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / rang byang chub kyi bar du de byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi tshig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / rang byang chub kyi bar du de byed pa'o //
translated: With the supreme words means up to the fruit of stream-entry, once-returner, and non-returner, and up to pratyekabuddha enlightenment.

original: de dag gi thabs ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: de dag gi thabs ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The means for those is the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: de dag bde bar bgyid pa ni bar chad sel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bde bar bgyid pa ni bar chad sel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are beneficial because they remove obstacles.

original: 'ji srid 'jig rten 'das pa'i ye shes ma thob pa de srid du ldongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ji srid 'jig rten 'das pa'i ye shes ma thob pa de srid du ldongs pa'o //
translated: As long as one has not attained supramundane wisdom, one is blind.

original: de dag gis de skyed par byed pa'i phyir snang bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis de skyed par byed pa'i phyir snang bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: They are illuminating because they cause that to arise.

original: 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spong bar byed pa de ni snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spong bar byed pa de ni snang ba ste /
translated: That which completely removes all fears and harms is illumination.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam nyid do //
translated: It is the supramundane path of cultivation itself.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni theg pa dman pa'i don @94a * //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni theg pa dman pa'i don @94a * //
translated: Up to this point, the meaning of the Hƒ´nayƒÅna has been taught.

original: bstan to // byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bstan to // byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With the meaning of the bodhisattvas in mind,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, ‚ÄúBlessed One,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi phyir gtso bo ste de la de nyid sgrub pa ni dmigs pa'i bye brag gi spyan lnga ste 'khor ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi phyir gtso bo ste de la de nyid sgrub pa ni dmigs pa'i bye brag gi spyan lnga ste 'khor ro //
translated: For the sake of others, the principal one, that is, the bodhisattva, accomplishes that, which is the five eyes with their specific objects.

original: tha mi dad pas ni de nyid spyan te chos thams cad don dam par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pas ni de nyid spyan te chos thams cad don dam par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye is that very [wisdom] because it sees all phenomena ultimately.

original: khyab par gzigs pa la bar chad gsum ste /
analyzed: khyab par gzigs pa la bar chad gsum ste /
translated: There are three obstacles to seeing pervasion:

original: gti mug dang / mun pa dang / rab rib bo //
analyzed: gti mug dang / mun pa dang / rab rib bo //
translated: ignorance, darkness, and cataracts.

original: de la gti mug ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la gti mug ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: Among them, ignorance is not knowing.

original: mun pa ni mun nag go //
analyzed: mun pa ni mun nag go //
translated: Darkness is obscurity.

original: rab rib ni mig gi nad do //üîΩde dag rab rib ma mchis par bgyi ba ni rnam par 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: rab rib ni mig gi nad do // de dag rab rib ma mchis par bgyi ba ni rnam par 'jig par byed do //
translated: Cataracts are eye diseases.üîΩThe phrase may they be free from cataracts means destroying them.

original: rab rib dang bral bar bgyid ba ni mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rab rib dang bral bar bgyid ba ni mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: The phrase may they be free from cataracts is a summary.

original: thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is common.

original: ci zhig skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: What does it generate?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, the Blessed One... and so on.

original: chos thams cad ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched do //
translated: All phenomena are the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid gsum ste kun brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid gsum ste kun brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: They have three natures: imagined, dependent, and perfected.

original: brtags pa ni mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: brtags pa ni mi byed pa ste /
translated: The imagined is not a creator.

original: de ni mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist as it is imagined.

original: gzhan dbang ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dbang ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: The relative is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir de mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir de mi byed pa'o //
translated: It does not do so because it is the counteragent to that.

original: yongs su grub pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The perfect is the dharma-element.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir de yang mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir de yang mi byed pa'o //
translated: It also does not do so because it is without beginning or end.

original: gal te yang dag pa'i shes pa byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa'i shes pa byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that right knowledge does so,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: thog ma med pa nas sems kyi rgyud la 'khrul pa ldog pa nyid na yang dag pa'i ye shes grub bo //
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas sems kyi rgyud la 'khrul pa ldog pa nyid na yang dag pa'i ye shes grub bo //
translated: because right knowledge is established when the error of the mind-continuum is reversed from beginningless time.

original: 'o na ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has said, etc.

original: lam log par kun tu rtog pa de dag lam rab tu bsgoms pas chos bdag med pa'i ye shes la 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: lam log par kun tu rtog pa de dag lam rab tu bsgoms pas chos bdag med pa'i ye shes la 'dzud par byed do //
translated: Those who imagine the path to be otherwise are led to the knowledge of the selflessness of dharmas by the cultivation of the path.

original: gang gi lam zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi lam zhe na /
translated: Whose path?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: The path to omniscience.

original: 'di tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa ste rdzogs so zhes bstan to//
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa ste rdzogs so zhes bstan to//
translated: This much is the knowledge of omniscience, it is taught.

original: de ni gzhan gyi don du yang bstan to //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi don du yang bstan to //
translated: And that is taught for the benefit of others.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs pa de ni gzhan gyi don du yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs pa de ni gzhan gyi don du yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
